decision_conditions: The proposed development constitutes permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 14, Class J of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). Prior approval is required and is granted as the Council has assessed the impact of the proposal and considers that there would be no unacceptable impact with regard to the design or external appearance of the development, in particular the impact of glare on occupiers of neighbouring land, subject to compliance with the stated conditions.
The solar PV equipment or solar thermal equipment must, so far as practicable, be sited so as to minimise its effect on the external appearance of the building and the amenity of the area.
To ensure compliance with the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 14, Class J of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
The solar PV equipment or solar thermal equipment is removed as soon as reasonably practicable when no longer needed.
To ensure compliance with the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 14, Class J of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Should the capacity of the of the solar PV equipment installed (together with any solar PV equipment installed under Class J(b)) to generate electricity exceed 1 megawatt the development would not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 14, Class J of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Roof mounted solar PV on non-domestic building
description: Installation of an 249.92 kWp roof-top Solar PV installation across two pitches on an existing warehouse building. The system will comprise of 568 x 440W PV panels, fitted flush to the roof on a low-rise mounting kit (not exceeding 0.2m from the existing roof plane)(Application under Class J, Part 14, Schedule 2 of the General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
